definition: Jia Sixie, sixth century writer and author of agricultural encyclopedia Essential skill to benefit the people 齊民要術|齐民要术[Qi2 min2 Yao4 shu4]
surname Jia
merchant/to buy
to think/to consider
harmonious

sentences.english: Jia Sixie is well-known as a pioneer in farming.
sentences.chinese: 贾思勰是一位有名的农学先驱。

sentences.english: Some people thought Jia Sixie was a lucky man.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为贾思勰是一个幸运的人。

sentences.english: Jia Sixie lived in the sixth century AD.
sentences.chinese: 贾思勰糊口在公元六世纪强大。

sentences.english: Jia Sixie did experiments and showed that his way was better.
sentences.chinese: 贾思勰作了试验，证明他的方法较好。

sentences.english: Jia Sixie is known as one of the pioneers of farming.
sentences.chinese: 贾思勰被认为是农学的先驱者之一。

sentences.english: Jia Sixie's book is a practical guide to farming.
sentences.chinese: 贾思勰的书是耕作的实用指南。

sentences.english: However, Jia Sixie did experiments and showed that his way was better.
sentences.chinese: 不过，贾思勰做了试验，证明他的方法比较好。

definition: Essential skill to benefit the people, sixth century encyclopedia of agricultural knowledge by Jia Sixie 賈思勰|贾思勰[Jia3 Si1 xie2]
Dream Pool Essays by Shen Kuo 沈括[Shen3 Kuo4], book on various fields of knowledge, the first to describe the magnetic needle compass
Jin Dynasty (265-420)

History of Eastern Han (later Han), third of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Fan Ye 范曄|范晔[Fan4 Ye4] in 445 during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋[Nan2 chao2 Song4], 120 scrolls
Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold, early Tang compendium of herbal medicine by Sun Simiao 孫思邈|孙思邈[Sun1 Si1 miao3]
Imperial Readings of the Taiping Era, general Song dynasty encyclopedia compiled during 977-983 under Li Fang 李昉[Li3 Fang3], 1000 scrolls
Extensive records of the Taiping era (978), fictional history edited by Li Fang 李昉
Baopuzi, collection of essays by Ge Hong 葛洪[Ge3 Hong2] on alchemy, immortality, legalism, society etc

History of Qi of the Southern Dynasties, seventh of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled by Xiao Zixian 蕭子顯|萧子显[Xiao1 Zi3 xian3] in 537 during Liang of the Southern Dynasties 南朝梁[Nan2 chao2 Liang2], 59 scrolls
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls
the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Eastern or later Han dynasty, 25-220
to write down/to record/written account
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls

Zhang Yi (c. 3rd century), literary figure from Wei of the Three Kingdoms, other name 稚讓|稚让[Zhi4 rang4], named as compiler of earliest extant Chinese encyclopedia 廣雅|广雅[Guang3 ya3] and several lost works
